OH.NAME: FIRST SEAT
OH.DESCRIPTION: Voices of Gussie Dubrin, Mrs. Freid - During much of the synagogue’s early history, women were not recognized members of the congregation. Their status gradually became formalized through membership opportunities and, in 1919, the formation of a Ladies’ Auxiliary.

OH.NAME: THE CHOLENT
OH.DESCRIPTION: Voice of Gussie Dubrin - Cholent: A traditional Jewish stew, developed over the centuries to conform with Jewish laws that prohibit cooking on the Sabbath.

OH.NAME: A POCKETFUL OF GRAPES
OH.DESCRIPTION: Voice of Max Smith - Yom Kippur: Day of Atonement. The holiest day of the year. Yom Kippur is traditionally observed with a 25-hour period of fasting and intensive prayer, with most of the day spent in synagogue services.

OH.NAME: HIGH HOLIDAYS
OH.DESCRIPTION: Voice of Miriam Aaron - Miriam Aaron reads from a letter she wrote to the Eldridge Street Project. - Edward Smith sings "Avinu Malkeinu" ("Our Father, Our King") a prayer recited during services on Rosh Hashanah (Jewish New Year) and Yom Kippur (Day of Atonement).

OH.NAME: A FLIGHT OF STAIRS
OH.DESCRIPTION: Voice of Mrs. Freid - According to Jewish Law, men and women must be separated during prayer, usually by a wall or curtain called a mechitzah, or by placing women in a second floor balcony.
